author: Odeinoichus
title: Parts of her World...
review:
Set #71012 Ariel: Rounding off the first, and hopefully not last, Disney Series of Minifigures is a Disney Princess, the first and only Disney Princess made into a minifigure form so far, Ariel.

Ariel is just another Mermaid Minifig, but she's got a brand new hair piece that truly captures the look of the character and a unique torso print compared to the previous Mermaids. The print carries over onto the back of the torso, again she only has the one facial expression. I believe this marks the first CMF Series not to include double-sided faces in a long while, at least available at full retail. She has a poor selection of accessories, instead of a 'dinglehopper' or Sebastian figure she's got a clam with a jewel. Not exactly something Ariel concerns herself with.

Strongly recommended. She's just so well executed and looks so strong, even with the poor choice in accessories Ariel is a must have figure. Ok LEGO, bring on Disney Series 2 for January next year.

author: tnridgerunner
title: Save your money
review: One of the more boring figures, IMO. The hairpiece doesn’t really have any lines to simulate strands of hair, which makes it look cheap and unrealistic. Because of this, it doesn’t work well with other figures, either. The rest of the figure is kind of “meh” as well, but the designers didn’t have much to work with on her. The clam is the only halfway decent part.
